Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server

Class VirtualClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.VirtualClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Player
    public abstract class VirtualClient
extends java.lang.Object
    A VirtualClient represents the communication layer of a Player. The goal of this class is to offer a communication API which is fully transparent to the Player, so that he can maintain all of the logical functions separated from the network aspect, while being able to easily communicate with his remote counterpart.
    See Also:
    Player

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private ClientCommunicationInterface communicationInterface
      The ClientCommunicationInterface used to send and receive NetworkMessages from his remote counterpart.

      Whether or not the VirtualClient resulted to be connected to the Server.
      private java.lang.Object messageReceivedLock
      The Lock object used to synchronize access to nextMessage object, so that only a blocking read at a time can be performed.
      private java.lang.Object messageSentLock
      The Lock object used to synchronize access to ClientCommunicationInterface instance, so that only a blocking write at a time can be performed.
      private MessageStatus messageStatus
      The status in which a NetworkMessage can be found.
      private java.lang.String name
      The VirtualClient name.
      private NetworkMessage nextMessage
      The last NetworkMessage received from the remote-client counterpart.

    • Field Detail

      • name

        private final java.lang.String name
        The VirtualClient name.

      • communicationInterface

        private ClientCommunicationInterface communicationInterface
        The ClientCommunicationInterface used to send and receive NetworkMessages from his remote counterpart.
        See Also:
        ClientCommunicationInterface, NetworkMessage

      • messageStatus

        private volatile MessageStatus messageStatus
        The status in which a NetworkMessage can be found. This flag is used to synchronize multiple calls on the same VirtualClient's nextMessage attribute, that can be modified through a multi-thread call to notifyReceived(NetworkMessage) and nextMessage() methods.

      • nextMessage

        private NetworkMessage nextMessage
        The last NetworkMessage received from the remote-client counterpart.

      • messageSentLock

        private final java.lang.Object messageSentLock
        The Lock object used to synchronize access to ClientCommunicationInterface instance, so that only a blocking write at a time can be performed.

      • messageReceivedLock

        private final java.lang.Object messageReceivedLock
        The Lock object used to synchronize access to nextMessage object, so that only a blocking read at a time can be performed.

      • connected

        private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean connected
        Whether or not the VirtualClient resulted to be connected to the Server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VirtualClient

        public VirtualClient​(java.lang.String name)
        This is the only constructor. It creates a new VirtualClient with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new VirtualClient name.

    • Method Detail

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Reports the VirtualClient's connection status (online or offline).
        Returns:
        true if and only if the VirtualClient is online.

      • setCommunicationInterface

        public void setCommunicationInterface​(ClientCommunicationInterface communicationInterface)
        Sets the VirtualClient ClientCommunicationInterface with the given one. Any method call involving sending and receiving any NetworkMessage performed before this method, will result in a thrown NullPointerException.
        Parameters:
        communicationInterface - the interface used to connect to the remote counterpart.

      • getCommunicationInterface

        public ClientCommunicationInterface getCommunicationInterface()
        Returns the VirtualClient's current ClientCommunicationInterface.
        Returns:
        the VirtualClient's current ClientCommunicationInterface.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the current name of this VirtualClient.
        Returns:
        the VirtualClient name.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(NetworkMessage message)
                 throws ConnectionException
        Forwards a NetworkMessage to the lower level trough a ClientCommunicationInterface.
        Parameters:
        message - the NetworkMessage to be forwarded.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any exception is thrown at a lower level.

      • deliver

        public void deliver​(Deliverable deliverable)
             throws ConnectionException
        Delivers a Deliverable to the remote client counterpart by encapsulating into a lower level NetworkMessage. This behavior emulates the Transport level in an ISO/OSI stack communication protocol.
        Parameters:
        deliverable - the Deliverable to be encapsulate.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any exception is thrown at a lower level.

      • nextMessage

        private NetworkMessage nextMessage()
                            throws ConnectionException
        Returns to the caller a NetworkMessage received from the VirtualClient remote counterpart. This is a blocking call, meaning the caller will wait until a new NetworkMessage is available or an exception is thrown. Note that calling this method subsequently guarantees that every time a different NetworkMessage is returned.
        Returns:
        the NetworkMessage received from the remote counterpart.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if the NetworkMessage remote sender encounters a network issue at any lower level.

      • nextDeliverable

        public Deliverable nextDeliverable()
                            throws ConnectionException
        Returns to the caller a Deliverable received from the VirtualClient remote counterpart. This is a blocking call, meaning the caller will wait until a new Deliverable is available or an exception is thrown. Note that calling this method subsequently guarantees that every time a different Deliverable is returned.
        Returns:
        the Deliverable received from the remote counterpart.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if any exception is thrown at a lower level.

      • notifyReceived

        public void notifyReceived​(NetworkMessage message)
        Notifies the VirtualClient that a new NetworkMessage has been received from its remote counterpart. The received NetworkMessage is stored in the local object nextMessage and the appropriated flag is set in order to end any blocking call to the nextMessage() method.
        Parameters:
        message - the new NetworkMessage received.

      • notifyConnected

        public void notifyConnected()
        Notifies the VirtualClient that he is now connected to the server and can officially start sending and/or receiving NetworkMessages from his remote client counterpart.

      • notifyDisconnected

        public void notifyDisconnected()
        Notifies the VirtualClient that he is no longer logged into the server and set the MessageStatus accordingly. This is done to end any wait action by other Threads listening on the nextMessage() method.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object object)
        Determines whether or not two VirtualClients are equals. This is true if and oly if thy both share the same name, such that equals() method called between the two name attributes returns true.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - the VirtualClient object which with to compare.
        Returns:
        true if and oly if the two VirtualClient's names are equals(), false otherwise.
        See Also:
        String.equals(Object)
